content.description:
Nice climbing up the middle of the beautiful face. The gear looks improbable, but the route actually protects pretty well. Go right up the middle using cracks and edges, and then finish on steep, juggy moves before topping it out. As of now, there is no anchor, so you have to top out and belay your partner from above.

The first ascent was a ground up onsight in the rain using an ice tool to clean moss out of cracks to place gear.
content.protection: Rack up to #1. C3s are helpful.
content.location: The center of Babylon. See photos.

content.description: Start by climbing up some mediocre blocky terrain behind the tree. After reaching the ledge, the rock and the climbing increases in quality. As the climbing gets steeper towards the top, the holds get more secure.
content.protection:
There's some good gear on the upper half, but I can't comment on the bottom.

You use gear up to a #1 Camalot. Â The bottom has a few small nut placements.
content.location: On the right side of Babylon. It follows an obvious crack that can be seen from below the crag (see the photo).
